Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall evaluate the need for action to eliminate the causes of nonconformities, in order that it does not recur or occur elsewhere, by:       a. reviewing the nonconformity       b. determining the causes of the nonconformity       c. determining if similar nonconformities exist, or could  potentially occur.

Name: Corrective action - Appropriate action needed
Risk: Data leakage caused by ineffective information security management system due to lack of implementing the appropriate action needed to the effects of the encountered nonconformities.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall implement the appropriate action needed to the effects of the encountered nonconformities.

Name: Corrective action - Review effectiveness
Risk: Data leakage caused by ineffective information security management system due to lack of reviewing the effectiveness of any corrective action taken.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall review the effectiveness of any corrective action taken.

Name: Corrective action - Document actions
Risk: Data leakage caused by ineffective information security management system due to lack of documenting the corrective actions taken against the nonconformities.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall document the corrective actions taken against the nonconformities.

Name: Continual improvement - Improvement of controls
Risk: Data leakage caused by ineffective information security management system due to lack of improving the suitability, adequacy and effectiveness of information security controls in place.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall improve the suitability, adequacy and effectiveness of information security controls in place.

Name: Continual improvement - Consider results
Risk: Data leakage caused by ineffective information security management system due to lack of taking into account the performance measurement results and incidents when identifying improvements.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall take account of the performance measurement results and incidents when identifying improvements.

Name: Asset management policy - Appropriate policy
Risk: Misuse of information assets due to lack of appropriate asset management policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the asset management policy shall be appropriate to the complexity of the entity and to the assets managed by the entity.

Name: Asset management policy -  Management commitment
Risk: Asset theft due to lack of including statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope of the asset management policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the asset management policy shall include statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope of the policy.

Name: Asset management policy - Roles and responsibilities
Risk: Asset theft due to lack of roles and responsibilities in the asset management policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the asset management policy shall outline the roles and responsibilities.

Name: Asset management policy - Framework
Risk: Misuse of information assets due to lack of providing the framework for managing the entity’s assets, including assignment of owners.
Treatment: Ensure that the asset management policy shall provide the framework for managing the entity’s assets, including assignment of owners.

Name: Asset management policy - BYOD
Risk: Cyber attack caused by compromised personal machine due to lack of framework for managing bring your own device (byod) arrangements.
Treatment: Ensure that the asset management policy shall provide the framework for managing bring your own device (byod) arrangements.

Name: Asset management policy - Document and communicate
Risk: Asset theft due to lack of documenting and communicating asset management policy to all users.
Treatment: Ensure that the asset management policy shall be documented and communicated to all users.

Name: Asset management policy - Read and acknowledge
Risk: Misuse of information assets due to lack of ensuring that all users formally read and acknowledge asset management policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the asset management policy shall be read and acknowledged formally by all users.

Name: Asset management policy - Maintenance, review, and update
Risk: Misuse of information assets due to lack of maintaining, reviewing and updating asset management policy at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.
Treatment: Ensure that the asset management policy shall be maintained, reviewed and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Inventory of assets - Identify
Risk: Asset theft due to lack of identifying an inventory of information assets within the entity.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall identify an inventory of information assets within the entity.

Name: Inventory of assets - Maintain
Risk: Asset theft due to lack of maintaining an up-to-date list of assets.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall maintain an up-to-date list of assets.

Name: Inventory of assets - Accuracy and consistency
Risk: Asset theft due to lack of ensuring accuracy and consistency with other inventories.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall ensure accuracy and consistency with other inventories.

Name: Ownership of assets - Establish process
Risk: Misuse of information assets due to lack of establishing the process for the assignment of asset ownership and its periodical review.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall establish the process for the assignment of asset ownership and its periodical review.

Name: Ownership of assets - Assign owner
Risk: Misuse of information assets due to lack of assigning an owner with management responsibility for each identified asset.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall assign an owner with management responsibility for each  identified asset.

Name: Acceptable use of assets - Establish rules
Risk: Misuse of information assets due to lack of establishing and documenting the rules for the acceptable use of assets.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall establish and document the rules for the acceptable use of assets.

Name: Acceptable use of assets - Adapt rules
Risk: Misuse of information assets due to lack of adapting rules to the different roles (management, users, administrators, operators, contractors, etc.) for the acceptable use of assets.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall adapt rules related to the acceptable use of assets to the different roles (management, users, administrators, operators, contractors, etc.).

Name: Acceptable use of assets - Circulation and acceptance
Risk: Misuse of information assets due to lack of ensuring circulation and acceptance of the rules by employees, contractors and third parties for the acceptable use of assets.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall ensure circulation and acceptance of the rules for the acceptable use of assets by employees, contractors and third parties.

Name: Acceptable use of assets
Risk: Misuse of information assets due to lack of ensuring compliance with the established rules.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall ensure compliance with the established rules.

Name: Acceptable bring your own device (BYOD) arrangements - Establish rules
Risk: cyber attack caused by compromised personal machine due to lack of establishing the rules for the acceptable use of personal assets that are used on the entity’s environment.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall establish the rules for the acceptable use of personal assets that are used on the entity’s environment.

Name: Acceptable bring your own device (BYOD) arrangements - Adapt rules
Risk: cyber attack caused by compromised personal machine due to lack of adapting rules to the different roles (management, users, administrators, operators, contractors, etc.) for byod.

Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of identifying the systems, applications and services that require user authentication.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall identify the systems, applications and services that require user authentication.

Name: Secure log on procedures - Classify systems
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of classifying the identified systems, applications and services based on the level of protection needed.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall classify the identified systems, application and services based on the level of protection needed.

Name: Secure log on procedures - Establish procedures
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of establishing the appropriate log-on and log-off procedures to minimize the opportunity for unauthorized access.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall establish the appropriate log-on and log-off procedures to minimize the opportunity for unauthorized access.

Name: Secure log on procedures - Maximum session time
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of setting a maximum session time for logged on users for sensitive systems and applications.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall set a maximum session time for logged on users for sensitive systems and applications.

Name: Secure log on procedures - Terminate sessions
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of terminating inactive sessions after a predefined period of inactivity.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall terminate inactive sessions after a predefined period of inactivity.

Name: User identification and authentication - Unique identifier
Risk: Identity theft caused by brute force attack due to lack of providing a unique identifier to each user.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall provide a unique identifier to each user.

Name: User identification and authentication - Authentication techniques
Risk: Identity theft due to lack of enabling authentication techniques that are suitable to entity.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall enable authentication techniques that are suitable to entity.

Name: User identification and authentication - Logging
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of ensuring all restricted activity are logged with the associated authenticated users.
Treatment: Ensure that all restricted activities are logged with the associated authenticated users.

Name: User credentials management system - Automate
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of automating the user credential management system as per the user credential change procedure ensuring the authenticity of the associate user identity.
Treatment: Ensure that the user credential management system shall automate the user credential change procedure ensuring the authenticity of the associate user identity.

Name: User credentials management system - Validate
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of validating that the changed credentials have sufficient strength for their intended use to ensure quality secret authentication.
Treatment: Ensure that the user credential management system shall validate that the changed credentials have sufficient strength for their intended use to ensure quality secret authentication.

Name: User credentials management system - Maximum lifetime
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of setting a maximum lifetime and reuse conditions for user credential management system.
Treatment: Ensure that the user credential management system shall set a maximum lifetime and reuse conditions.

Name: Use of system utilities - Identify utilities
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of identifying the system utilities and identifying the respective appropriate level of protection.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall identify the system utilities and identify the respective appropriate level of protection.

Name: Use of system utilities - Track of user access rights
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of keeping track of the users access rights provided to the system utilities.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall keep track of the users access rights provided to the system utilities.

Name: Use of system utilities - Restrict usage
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of restricting the use of utility programs only to authorized personnel.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall restrict use of utility programs only to authorized personnel.

Name: Use of system utilities - Monitor usage
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of monitoring the use of utility programs.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall monitor the use of utility programs.

Name: Information access restriction - Restrict
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of ensuring that access to information and application system functions is restricted.
Treatment: Ensure that the access to information and application system functions is restricted.

Name: Information access restriction - Basis of restriction
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of ensuring that access restriction is based on user’s roles and responsibilities.
Treatment: Ensure that the access restriction is based on user’s roles and responsibilities.

Name: Information access restriction - Assign access rights
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of assigning the appropriate level of access rights to information and application functions.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall assign the appropriate level of access rights to information and application functions.

Name: Information access restriction - Adjust access control
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of adjusting the access control for entity shall for each user and support personnel, based on specific business needs.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall for each user and support personnel, adjust their access control based on specific business needs.

Name: Sensitive system isolation - Identify sensitive applications
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of identifying sensitive applications and allocating the appropriate resources to ensure its security.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall identify sensitive applications and allocate the appropriate resources to ensure its security.

Name: Publicly accessible content - Develop procedures
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of developing and formalizing procedures for the publishing of public information to ensure non-public information is not exposed.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall develop and formalize procedures for the publishing of public information to ensure non-public information is not exposed.

Name: Publicly accessible content - Adopt procedures
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of adopting procedures to periodically verify if sensitive information is exposed to the general public.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall adopt procedures to periodically verify if sensitive information is exposed to the general public.

Name: Access control for mobile devices - Establish security measures
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of establishing security measures for usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for entity-controlled mobile devices in line with the access control policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall establish security measures for usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for entity-controlled mobile devices in line with the access control policy.

Name: Access control for mobile devices - Authorize connection of mobile devices
Risk: Malware infection due to lack of authorizing connection of mobile devices to organizational information systems in accordance with the established security measures.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall authorize connection of mobile devices to organizational information systems in accordance with the established security measures.

Name: Teleworking - Establish security measures
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of establishing security measures for using teleworking in line with the access control policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall establish security measures for using teleworking in line with the access control policy.

Name: Teleworking - Authorize the usage of teleworking
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of authorizing the usage of teleworking in accordance with the established security measures.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall authorize the usage of teleworking in accordance with the established security measures.

Name: Third-party security policy  - Appropriate policy
Risk: Damage caused by a third party due to lack of appropriate third party security policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the third party security policy shall be appropriate to the relationship of the entity and the third party.

Name: Third-party security policy - Management commitment
Risk: Damage caused by a third party due to lack of statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope in the third party security policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the third party security policy shall include statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope of the policy.

Name: Third-party security policy - Roles and responsibilities
Risk: unintentional misuse of information asset due to lack of outlining the roles and responsibilities for managing third party.
Treatment: Ensure that the third party security policy shall outline the roles and responsibilities for managing third party.

Name: Third-party security policy - Framework
Risk: unintentional misuse of information asset due to lack of providing the framework for setting information security objectives and/or including information security objectives to be used when engaging third parties.
Treatment: Ensure that the third party security policy shall provide the framework for setting information security objectives and/or include information security objectives to be used when engaging third parties.

Name: Third-party security policy - Communicate
Risk: Damage caused by a third party due to lack of documenting and communicating third party security policy to the third party.
Treatment: Ensure that the third party security policy shall be documented and communicated to the third party.

Name: Third-party security policy - Read and acknowledge
Risk: Damage caused by a third party due to lack of ensuring that the third party security policy shall be read and acknowledged formally by the third party.
Treatment: Ensure that the third party security policy shall be read and acknowledged formally by the third party.

Name: Third-party security policy - Maintenance, review, and update
Risk: Damage caused by a third party due to lack of maintaining, reviewing and updating third party security policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the third party security policy shall be maintained, reviewed and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Service delivery - Security requirements
Risk: Damage caused by a third party due to lack of ensuring that security requirements for third parties are included in the service delivery agreement for each party.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall ensure that security requirements for third parties are included in the service delivery agreement for each party.

Name: Service delivery - Measurable requirements
Risk: Damage caused by a third party due to lack of ensuring that the security requirements are measurable.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall ensure these security requirements are measurable.

Name: Service delivery - Report on requirements
Risk: Damage caused by a third party due to lack of requiring third parties to measure and report to the entity on the service requirements.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall require third parties to measure and report to the entity on these service requirements.

Name: Monitoring and review of third-party services - Delivery reports
Risk: Damage caused by a third party due to lack of monitoring third parties’ services and ensuring that required delivery reports are received.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall monitor third parties’ services and ensure required delivery reports are received.

Name: Monitoring and review of third-party services - Qualified personnel
Risk: Damage caused by a third party due to lack of ensuring that reports received from third parties are reviewed by qualified personnel.
Treatment: Ensure that reports received from third parties are reviewed by qualified personnel.

Name: Monitoring and review of third-party services - Incident and problems
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of ensuring that information security incidents and problems identified in the reports are managed properly.
Treatment: Ensure that information security incidents and problems identified in the reports are managed properly.

Name: Monitoring and review of third-party services - Audits
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of carrying out audits for third parties services at a regular basis.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall carry out audits for third parties services at a regular basis.

Name: Managing changes to third-party services - Service agreements
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of ensuring that third party service agreements include a methodology for communicating change management issues between the entity and the third party.
Treatment: Ensure that third party service agreements include a methodology for communicating change management issues between the entity and the third party.

Name: Managing changes to third-party services - Parameters for changes
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of defining the parameters for changes that must be communicated between the entity and the third party.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define the parameters for changes that must be communicated between the entity and the third party.

Name: Managing changes to third-party services - Assess changes
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of assessing the changes taking into account the criticality of business systems and processes involved and re-assessment of risks.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall assess the changes taking into account the criticality of business systems and processes involved and re-assessment of risks.

Name: Information security requirements for cloud environments - Due diligence
Risk: Breach of legislation due to lack of performing necessary due diligence to determine requirements and restrictions relevant to information processing, storage and retention in the cloud environment.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall perform necessary due diligence to determine requirements and restrictions relevant to information processing, storage and retention in the cloud environment.

Name: Information security requirements for cloud environments - Cloud environment
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of including the cloud environment (and, where possible, its components) into the risk assessment process.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall include the cloud environment (and, where possible, its components) into the risk assessment process.

Name: Information security requirements for cloud environments - Governance policies and procedures
Risk: Breach of legislation due to lack of developing and maintaining information governance policies and procedures to ensure compliance with identified requirements and risk mitigation strategies.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall develop and maintain information governance policies and procedures to ensure compliance with identified requirements and risk mitigation strategies.

Name: Information security requirements for cloud environments - Information security incidents
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of ensuring that the information about security incidents that happen at the cloud service provider are communicated.
Treatment: Ensure that information about security incidents that happen at the cloud service provider are communicated.

Name: Information security requirements for cloud environments - Right to audit
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of reserving a right to audit the security arrangements in place at cloud service provider.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall where possible, reserve a right to audit the security arrangements in place at cloud service provider.

Name: Service delivery agreements with cloud providers - Service delivery agreement
Risk: Breach of legislation due to lack of including provisions for understanding and maintaining awareness of where information with applicable restrictions will be stored or transmitted in the cloud environment as part of the agreement.
Treatment: Ensure that each service delivery agreement for cloud services shall include provisions for understanding and maintaining awareness of where information with applicable restrictions will be stored or transmitted in the cloud environment.

Name: Service delivery agreements with cloud providers - Information migration plans
Risk: Disruption of critical cloud services due to lack of including provisions for ensuring appropriate information migration plans at the end of the service period as part of the agreement.
Treatment: Ensure that each service delivery agreement for cloud services shall include provisions for ensuring appropriate information migration plans at the end of the service period.

Name: Service delivery agreements with cloud providers - Cloud security requirements
Risk: Breach of legislation due to lack of including provisions for ensuring all other cloud security requirements determined relevant by the entity are included in the service delivery agreement.
Treatment: Ensure that each service delivery agreement for cloud services shall include provisions for ensuring all other cloud security requirements determined relevant by the entity are included in the service delivery agreement.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Appropriate policy
Risk: Disclosure of critical application data due to lack of appropriate information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance  policy shall be appropriate to the relationship of the entity and all internal and external parties involved in the process.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Management commitment
Risk: Disclosure of critical application data due to lack of including statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope in the information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance  policy shall include statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope of the policy.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Roles and responsibilities
Risk: Human/user error due to lack of outlining the roles and responsibilities in the information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance  policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance  policy shall outline the roles and responsibilities.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Framework
Risk: Disclosure of critical application data due to lack of providing the framework for setting information security objectives and/or include information security objectives to be used when engaging in  the process of information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance.
Treatment: Ensure that the information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance  policy shall provide the framework for setting information security objectives and/or include information security objectives to be used when engaging in  the process.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Communicate
Risk: Disclosure of critical application data due to lack of documenting and communicating information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance  policy to all users.
Treatment: Ensure that the information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance  policy shall be documented and communicated to all users.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Read and acknowledge
Risk: Disclosure of critical application data due to lack of ensuring that information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance  policy is read and acknowledged formally by all users.
Treatment: Ensure that the information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance  policy shall be read and acknowledged formally by all users.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Maintenance, review, and update
Risk: Disclosure of critical application data due to lack of maintaining, reviewing and updating information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance  policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance  policy shall be maintained, reviewed and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Security requirements analysis and specification - New information systems or enhancements
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of using security requirements for new information systems or enhancements to existing information systems.
Treatment: Ensure that the security requirements shall be used for new information systems or enhancements to existing information systems.

Name: Security requirements analysis and specification - Approval
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of approval of security requirements by the appropriate business manager or equivalent.
Treatment: Ensure that the security requirements shall be approved by the appropriate business manager or equivalent.

Name: Security requirements analysis and specification - Address all requirements
Risk: Disruption of critical systems due to lack of all addressing security requirements identified during the risk assessment.
Treatment: Ensure that the security requirements shall address all requirements for security controls identified during the risk assessment.

Name: Security requirements analysis and specification - Verify security controls
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of outlining how to verify that the requirements for security controls have been met.
Treatment: Ensure that the security requirements shall outline how to verify that the requirements for security controls have been met.

Name: Security requirements analysis and specification - Security requirements
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of including security requirements in the statement of business and technical requirements.
Treatment: Ensure that the security requirements shall be included in the statement of business and technical requirements.

Name: Developer-provided training - Training requirements
Risk: Human/user error due to lack of requiring the developer to identify training requirements based on implemented security functions for the correct use and operation of the functions.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall require the developer to identify training requirements based on implemented security functions and in line with the awareness and training policy for the correct use and operation of the functions.

Name: Developer-provided training - Training programs
Risk: Human/user error due to lack of requiring the developer to design and execute appropriate training programs to meet training requirements requirements.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall require the developer to design and execute appropriate training programs to meet these requirements.

Name: Developer-provided training - Training provisions
Risk: Human/user error due to lack of requiring the developer to include training provisions in the relevant service delivery agreement.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall require the developer to include training provisions in the relevant service delivery agreement.

Name: Input data validation - Guidelines or parameters
Risk: Unavailability of application due to lack of defining a set of guidelines or parameters to be used to validate data input into applications.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define a set of guidelines or parameters to be used to validate data input into applications.

Name: Input data validation - Set of values
Risk: Unavailability of application due to lack of defining a set of values for each guideline or parameter to identify acceptable and unacceptable values.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define a set of values for each guideline or parameter to identify acceptable and unacceptable values.

Name: Input data validation - Validation
Risk: Unavailability of application due to lack of providing guidance on how to validate each guideline or parameter.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall provide guidance on how to validate each guideline or parameter.

Name: Control of internal processing - Guidelines to developers
Risk: Unavailability of application due to lack of providing guidelines to application developers on minimum requirements for validation checks for applications under development.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall provide guidelines to application developers on minimum requirements for validation checks for applications under development.

Name: Control of internal processing - Compliance
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of requiring application developers to provide evidence of compliance with minimum requirements.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall require application developers to provide evidence of compliance with minimum requirements.

Name: Control of internal processing - Periodic review
Risk: Unavailability of application due to lack of periodically reviewing existing applications to ensure validation checks included during their development still met minimum requirements.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall periodically review existing applications to make sure validation checks included during their development still met minimum requirements.

Name: Message integrity - Identify requirements
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of identifying requirements to ensure authenticity and integrity of messages transmitted between systems and applications.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall identify requirements to make sure authenticity and integrity of messages transmitted between systems and applications.

Name: Message integrity - Adopt controls
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of adopting proper controls to address the identified requirements.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall adopt proper controls to address the identified requirements.

Name: Output data validation - Output validation
Risk: Unavailability of application due to lack of defining output validation procedures to ensure that the processing of stored information is correct and appropriate to the circumstances.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define output validation procedures to ensure that the processing of stored information is correct and appropriate to the circumstances.

Name: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls - Document policy
Risk: Man in the middle attack due to lack of developing and documenting a policy for the use of cryptographic controls in line with the criticality of the information to be protected.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall develop and document a policy for the use of cryptographic controls in line with the criticality of the information to be protected.

Name: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls - Sector or national level restrictions
Risk: Breach of legislation due to lack of ensuring that the policy takes into account the sector or national level restrictions including regulatory requirements.
Treatment: Ensure that the cryptographic controls  policy takes into account the sector or national level restrictions.

Name: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls - Share policy
Risk: Human/user error due to lack of sharing the cryptographic policy with relevant users.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall share the policy with relevant users.

Name: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls - Review and update policy
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of reviewing and updating the cryptographic policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall review and update the policy at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Key management - Develop policy
Risk: Breach of legislation due to lack of developing a key management policy and process to control the generation of keys as per regulatory requirements.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall develop a key management policy and process to control the generation of keys taking into account regulatory issuances with regard to key management.

Name: Key management - Key storing standards
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of defining key storing standards.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define key storing standards.

Name: Key management - Define procedures
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of defining procedures to revoke/block keys and to repair damage or corrupted keys.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define procedures to revoke/block keys and to repair damage or corrupted keys.

Name: Key management - Protect keys against loss
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of protecting all cryptographic keys against modification and loss.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall protect all cryptographic keys against modification and loss.

Name: Key management - Protect keys against disclosure
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of protecting secret and private keys against unauthorized use and disclosure.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall protect secret and private keys against unauthorized use and disclosure.

Name: Control of operational software - Installation of software
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of allowing the installation of software only by authorized administrators.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall allow the installation of software only by authorized administrators.

Name: Control of operational software - Inhibit installation
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of inhibiting installation of software by users, unless justified by their role/business need.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall inhibit installation of software by users, unless justified by their role/business need.

Name: Control of operational software - Original copy
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of keeping an original copy of every installed software, including  previous versions.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall keep an original copy of every installed software, including  previous versions.

Name: Control of operational software - Rollback strategy
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of having a rollback strategy.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall have a rollback strategy.

Name: Control of operational software - Audit log
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of having an audit log of all software installations.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall have an audit log of all software installations.

Name: Protection of system test data - Sample data sets
Risk: Unauthorized access to the test data due to lack of using sample data sets to test data applications.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall use sample data sets to test data applications.

Name: Protection of system test data - Limit the transfer of data
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of limiting the transfer of real data from production environment to the test environment.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall limit the transfer of real data from production environment to the test environment, and to be done only after the appropriate authorization.

Name: Protection of system test data - Erase data
Risk: Unauthorized access to the test data due to lack of erasing any data from test applications immediately after testing is completed.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall erase any data from test applications immediately after testing is completed.

Name: Protection of system test data - Track of copy/erase
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of keeping track of any copy/erase of data between production and testing environment.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall keep track of any copy/erase of data between production and testing environment.

Name: Access control to program source code - Define policy
Risk: Unauthorized changes to application (source code) due to lack of defining an access control policy to source code.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define an access control policy to source code.

Name: Access control to program source code - Periodic review
Risk: Unauthorized changes to application due to lack of defining and periodically reviewing permissions.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define and periodically review permissions.

Name: Access control to program source code - Audit log
Risk: Unauthorized changes to application (source code) due to lack of keeping an audit log of all accesses.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall keep an audit log of all accesses.

Name: Change control procedures - Develop procedure
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of developing a change control procedure.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall develop a change control procedure.

Name: Change control procedures - Track record
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of keeping track record of all changes.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall keep track record of all changes.

Name: Change control procedures - Copy of every version
Risk: Disruption of critical application/software due to lack of keeping a copy of every version of the software, adopting appropriate integrity verification procedures.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall keep a copy of every version of the software, adopting appropriate integrity verification procedures.

Name: Change control procedures - Update documents
Risk: Human/user error due to lack of ensuring that all relevant documentations are up-to-date.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall ensure all relevant documentations are up-to-date.

Name: Change control procedures - Proper planning
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of ensuring proper planning to perform changes implementation at the right time.
Treatment: Ensure that proper planning to perform changes implementation at the right time.

Name: Technical review of applications after operating system changes - Test applications
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of testing any application in a testing environment when operating systems are changed (including patches and configurations).
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall test any application in a testing environment when operating systems are changed (including patches and configurations).

Name: Technical review of applications after operating system changes - Monitoring
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of monitoring operating system and application logs for any anomaly.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall monitor operating system and application logs for any anomaly.

Name: Technical review of applications after operating system changes - Rollback procedure
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of defining a rollback procedure.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall always define a rollback procedure.

Name: Technical review of applications after operating system changes - Asset database
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of ensuring that changes are reflected in any asset database and in any technical contingency plan.
Treatment: Ensure that changes are reflected in any asset database and in any technical contingency plan.

Name: Restrictions of changes to software packages - Approval of changes
Risk: Unauthorized access and/changes due to lack of defining who is entitled to approve changes to software/applications.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define who is entitled to approve changes to software/applications.

Name: Restrictions of changes to software packages - Testing change
Risk: Disruption of critical services due to lack of testing any change in a testing environment before moving it to production environment.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall test any change in a testing environment before moving it to production environment.

Name: Restrictions of changes to software packages - Major changes
Risk: Exploitation of application vulnerabilities due to lack of  performing secure code review for critical software and applications.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall in case of major changes in critical software and applications, perform a secure code review.

Name: Information leakage - Data leak prevention solution
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of adopting data leak prevention (dlp) measures.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall adopt data leak prevention (dlp) measures.

Name: Information leakage - Access management solutions
Risk: Misuse of information assets due to lack of adopting identity and access management solutions to limit access to critical data only to authorized personnel.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall adopt identity and access management solutions to limit access to critical data only to authorized personnel.

Name: Information leakage - Information classification policy
Risk: Misuse of information assets due to lack of defining and enforcing a data/information classification policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define and enforce a data/information classification policy.

Name: Outsourced software development - Security coding policy
Risk: Exploitation of application vulnerabilities due to lack of defining a secure coding policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define a secure coding policy.

Name: Outsourced software development - Quality assurance (QA) process
Risk: Disruption of critical application due to lack of defining a quality assurance (qa) process.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define a quality assurance (qa) process.

Name: Outsourced software development - Software acquisition contract
Risk: Breach of legislation due to lack of including in the software acquisition contract a clause to oblige third part to be compliant to entity secure coding policy, to align to entity qa process.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall include in the software acquisition contract a clause to oblige third part to be compliant to entity secure coding policy, to align to entity qa process. the contract shall also include the possibility to conduct audit on the third party.

Name: Outsourced software development - Software development contract
Risk: Breach of legislation due to lack of specifying in the software development contract any requirement and information security functionality.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall specify in the software development contract any requirement and information security functionality.

Name: Outsourced software development - Source code review
Risk: Exploitation of application vulnerabilities due to lack of conducting a source code review to identify potential vulnerabilities and/or malicious code or code that does not conform to the functionalities required.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall conduct a source code review to identify potential vulnerabilities and/or malicious code or code that does not conform to the functionalities required.

Name: Control of technical vulnerabilities - Vulnerabilities in new systems
Risk: Exploitation of application vulnerabilities due to lack of identifying vulnerabilities in new systems and applications and define a remediation plan before placing them in a production environment.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall identify vulnerabilities in new systems and applications and define a remediation plan before placing them in a production environment.

Name: Control of technical vulnerabilities - Production systems
Risk: Exploitation of application vulnerabilities due to lack of testing, reviewing, checking, and verifying the presence of vulnerabilities in production systems throughout the development life-cycle, preferably by the use of automated testing tools.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall test, review, check, and verify the presence of vulnerabilities in production systems throughout the development life-cycle, preferably by the use of automated testing tools.

Name: Control of technical vulnerabilities - Cost-Benefit-Analysis (CBA)
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of performing a cost-benefit-analysis (cba) for vulnerabilities to determine the proper remediation plan, where appropriate.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall perform a cost-benefit-analysis (cba) for vulnerabilities to determine the proper remediation plan, where appropriate.

Name: Supply chain protection strategy - Define policy
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of defining a policy to regulate the acquisition of products and services, including not to disclose to the supplier any unnecessary details about the entity’s configurations and architectures.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define a policy to regulate the acquisition of products and services. such a policy shall include not to disclose to the supplier any unnecessary details about the entity’s configurations and architectures.

Name: Supply chain protection strategy - Compliance to security requirements
Risk: Cyber attack due to lack of checking for every product/service delivered its compliance to security requirements defined by the policy.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall check for every product/service delivered its compliance to security requirements defined by the policy.

Name: Supply chain protection strategy - Contract
Risk: Breach of legislation due to lack of defining in the contract with the supplier that compliance with the entity security policy is required.
Treatment: Ensure that the entity shall define in the contract with the supplier that compliance with the entity security policy is required.

Name: Supply chain protection strategy - Incentivize transparency
Risk: Data leakage due to lack of incentivizing transparency into the security practices of the supplier.
